oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lockette with an image of Sgt. William Kendell Wilson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Image of Union soldier Sgt. William Kendell Wilson, Co. A, 6th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA The soldier was from Seymour, Tenn. (Wilson Branch), Shuck's Gap, Blount County, Tenn. He was captured neat Knoxville on January 8, 1864 and sent to Andersonville Prison Camp in south Georgia. Wilson died of diarrhea on August 14, 1864 and is buried at Andersonville. He wears a US cap with an officer's infantry bugle on the front and what is probably a US enlisted frock coat. The image is in a brass patriotic case.
